Package ca.nrc.cadc.accesscontrol.mail

Class Mailer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.nrc.cadc.accesscontrol.mail.Mailer
  • public class Mailer
extends java.lang.Object
    Mailer is a very simple utility class for sending SMTP email. At the very least, all that a client needs to do to send email is to invoke the static send method:

    Mailer.send(toList, ccList, bccList, replyToList, from, subject, text);

    Note that the class requires the mail.smtp.host system propriety to be set to the name of the smtp server

    Note 2: When the unitTest system property is set at this class level (e.g.: ca.nrc.cadc.util.mail.Mailer.unitTest) or at the package level (e.g.: ca.nrc.cadc.unitTest or ca.nrc.cadc.util.mail.unitTest) the send method performs all the normal execution steps EXCEPT the actual dispatch of the message. This kind of behaviour is useful during the unit testing of the clients when the email messages are not required to be sent out.

      • doSend

        public void doSend()
            throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Method to send an email message.
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - Email problems
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the object is not initialized properly.

      • send

        public static boolean send​(java.lang.String[] recipient,
                           java.lang.String[] cc,
                           java.lang.String[] bcc,
                           java.lang.String sender,
                           java.lang.String[] replyTo,
                           java.lang.String subject,
                           java.lang.String message)
        Convenience method to send email
        Parameters:
        recipient - recipient(s) of the message. Cannot be null.
        cc - cc list. Can be null.
        bcc - bcc list. Can be null.
        sender - the sender of the message. Cannot be null.
        replyTo - addresses to be used for reply. Can be null.
        subject - the subject of the message. Cannot be null.
        message - the body of the message. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true if message successfully send, or false otherwise (log message details the cause of the failure).
